author: aaron
title: Outstanding, this set is super versatile and very fun :)
review:
Overall Value: 4++ (cost+aesthetics+technical+build)/4: A great Technic set, fun to build, cool mechanisms, great useful parts, This is the year’s best set, a must must have. :) 
----------
Cost: 5 : Lots of great parts, a huge set for the money
$0.08 per element ($149.99 US / 1884 elements)

Aesthetics: 4 : Utilitarian and appropriate 

Form/Function: This is a large model, and the mechanisms are awesome

Elements: Good mixture of stud and studless parts, Electric motor, (same as the one used in the RC cars),  battery box, two dacta clutches, two Pneumatic cylinders, a compact turntable, and lots of gears and wheels

Technical: 5 : so great….
Engine / Drivetrain: 6 cylinder, differential to two drive wheels.
Suspension: none
Steering: 6 wheel steering, hand of god off back of rig 
Actuations: Outboard stabilizers, also driven via hand of god off back of rig , 3 stage boom (unfortunately this used a cable to actuate this and not a chain as shown in some photos), a transmission to switch the motor drive modes between the cable and boom deployment, pneumatics to lift the boom, and the crane can swivel manually 360 degrees, but is not driven.
 
Build: 5: This is a big build with great features

Steering (6 wheel): there is cool gearing to make the front most wheels turn in a larger arc than the second most and rear ones, the makes the model quite maneuverable, the third set of wheels drive a differential that connects the drive train to the 6 cylinder engine. 

The outboard stabilizers have a nice over center locking feature and are driven by a hand of god wheel / worm drive on the rear of the rig. 

The boom has three stages and is extended with the electric motor, There is a clever transmission mechanism to switch between the boom and the deployment of the cable, however this is not done independently, the intent of this was to automatically feed out the cable as the boom extends and reel in the cable as the boom retracts, unfortunately when the cable is fully deployed, the spooling direction of the cable can flip, and the boom will try to deploy as the cable is being spooled up and vice versa.

The motor is quite powerful and there are clutch packs to prevent overdriving both the boom deployment and the cable.  I like that the weight of the battery box can act as a counterbalance for the crane when lifting items. 

The pneumatic cylinders are used in a pretty simple setup to lift the boom, due to the weight of the boom the cylinders are not connected in the down stroke.

The only real complaint is that the turntable to swivel the crane is not driven by a hand of god wheel as in previous crane models i.e (8431).

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Best in years!
review: I searched for this kit ever since it was released, one week I called all of the toy stores in the state looking for it. Last week a new shipment came to town and I got one. My gosh what a set. Huge size, great parts, very clever design in many areas of the model. Others have said it too so just go and get one, lego boy!

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Heavy competition
review:
This set is really something, the big mobile crane is marvelously manuverable, thanks to the three-wheel steering, it´s crane extends just high enough for it to look realistic. The whole set is sturdy enough for childs play, but that´s not likely is it? This crane-vehicle is needless to say beautiful, and functional too.

The assembly is a delight, thanks to easy instructions, and the technical solutions. The vehicle that bears the crane is fairly lightweight, in comparison to the "crane-part" of the set, which holds battery box and motor, so the Mobile Crane has a highly positioned point of weight, which is undesirably in the lifting business. No smoke without fire though, this property justifies the outboard stabilizers, which really does help when lifting sideways.

Lifting, yes, the real purpose of the set, is an sadly an Achilles heal, the crane is not strong, but Technic Lego is according to me much more than pure labouring devices, so it doesn´t bother me much. The pneumatics are only connected on the up stroke, the weight of the crane is enough for lowering. I, however, strongly recommend connecting the down stroke too, thus giving the crane considerably more stability, and easens lowering of the crane, which was tricky before.

Ultimately, this set is excuisitively versatile and fun, and on a "need to know basis", you just gotta get it!

Greetings from Sweden, neigh(boring) country to Legoland ;)

author: legolover
title: Outstanding
review:
This is a perfect set for any experienced Lego builder. It rates a 6 out of 5 for me. First I'll list the good things.

-Mechanics- 
This set was so well designed inside, that I was questioning myself how they thought of all of this. Being the biggest Technic set, I knew it would be overflowing with cool little things but still found myself shocked. The steering is great, pneumatics works fine, and the stabalizing mechanism had me in a bit of a giddy state.

-Appearence-
For not having a lot of studded pieces, I found this set to have a very realistic look.

Now for the bad things.

-Repeating-
I am someone who is not so very fond of repeating steps. With this set, I didn;t have to repeat certain parts, I had to repeat the whole bottom! Twice in a row, i had to repeat the bottom because of one nasty bad luck gear. In total, I built the bottom 3 times and the top 1 1/2. The half is because I started building the crane part but got bored. Then I forgot what page I was on. I had already built the other part of the crane anyways.

-Measurements-
I hated having to precisley cut the tubing to it's exact measurement. 

-Stickers-
I think this part is self-explanatory.

If there wasn't any need for the rebuild, I would probably have had more pros. In the end, this set is perfect for any collector.

author: dunx125
title: Fantastic - Great pieces, great functions, great value. A classic set
review:
I bought this set 2nd hand a couple of days ago, for about $730. I was first amazed at the sheer quantity of pieces - with tonnes of gears, beams and connectors. The build was very difficult, but still huge fun. It took me about 8 hours, and was very satisfying. It is a very beautiful model, with great attention to detail. I particluarly liked the choice of colours, and the placement of stickers. I will not bother to list the features, for it is mentioned in previous reviews, but I was really impressed by the system to control the crane. Anyway, onto the pros and cons:

Pros
> Challenging and very enjoyable build
> Looks fantastic - just like the real thing
> Great selection of pieces
> Loads of features, all done perfectly
> Great fun to play with
> Very good value

Cons
> It can not pick up heavy items, as the pneumatics can not handle them.
> The direction of the reeling changes a lot, making it sometimes difficult to extend th boom

On the whole, an amazing set. A great addition to any and every collection

author: Tholias
title: Big..
review:
Going straigth away to the Pro's:
- Big..
- Comes with a standard motor
- Good realistic look, due to the combination of both studded and studless parts in the right places.
- A number of nice features, including six wheel steering, stabilisation "legs" and pneumatics

Cons:
- The downwards movement of the crane arm, is too fast.. it causes the whole thing to come crashin down
- Lengthening the arm, often causes some trouble with the wire..

author: bizkit
title: The deal of my life :))
review:
I accidentally stumbled upon this set in a shop which was selling out everything. I was amazed when I saw it. It was the last crane set in the shop and it only cost 55 euro(70 dollar). I wanted it since 2005 so I gathered my money as fast as I could, because missing this opportunity would have been a BIG mistake.

It's an amazing looking set, not the best but a great one. Took me 14 hours to build, because I wanted to enjoy it as long as a could. There were a lot of pieces that I've seen for the first time and this yellow color looks so nice. What I really enjoyed that they combined the older technik building style with bricks with holes and the newer beam system. I liked the old brick system more, because it was easier to creat with it, but as a collector I must say the new beams look better.

The best functional part of it is the base unit: the six wheel steering works marvellously, the truck is agile like a little car, at the first look it was odd that you controle it from the back, but hey can't put everything on the top of the truck; the four retracktable outriggers work fine, altho you must spin that little wheel on the back for some time for the system to work. The crane part is great looking but not so functional. I miss 2 things in it: it would have been nice to turn the turntable with gears rather then with you hand; and... the pneumatic sistem for this well design crane is wrong. I don't get it why didn't they put tubing for the lowering of the boom. It would not complicated much the actual structure of the crane... and this way it simply falls down, no fun in that, I have to catch to boom every time and put a warning for others to handle with care :). The problem could be solved by putting tubes where they are missing, completing the pneumatic system this way. I think that everybody got the extra pneumatic T piece, so hold on to it and gets some tubes (I wish I have some tubes right now).       

But over all I give it 5 out of 5. It's great to have it.

author: BigMac
title: Best ever crane. Awesome. Possible best ever Technic
review:
I bought this as new from Ebay for more than one year and just had time to finish this last week. I paid AUD 315, actually this is still the most expensive one I paid for, but definitely more than worth.

Before I build this one I found the Space Shuttle  8480 was the most sophisticated machine, and also I rate 8480 as the best Technic. now I think could be equal best as the second model of 8480, the submarine is also superb. Just by appearance the second model of 8421, I have not try yet, seems not as great.

Basically all the pros were mentioned by several very experienced collectors in this forum before, but I still want to reiterate several merits of the set,

1. The synchronized action of the extendable crane arms, the two arms ( smaller one inside the bigger) extending / returning at the same time. Very innovative attempt and the result is almost perfect.

2. The synchronized action of the extendable arms and the recoiling wheel of the cable for the metal hook. Good try but its not too perfect, as the speed ratio is not complying with each other.( see below for how to improve it).

3. Six wheels steering, first time in lego as I can remember, and with agreat result.

There are still two cons ( just for demanding collectors only) as below, 

1. The strength of the pneumaitic cyclinders are not strong enough for heavy load, especially when the arms are fully extended. May be in future they can use the linear actuator, which is a bit stronger, to replace the pneumatics. Don't get me wrong, I still find pneumatics are good and easier to apply than linear actuator but just not enough power in this case only.

2. I dare to say that the design of the pnematic part of ths super set was not carefull enough. To have a better control of the down movement of the crane arm, as mentioned by another review before, the air outlet/ inlet of the pneumatic pistons should all been collected, cannot have the downward outlet open. The reasons is that the crane arm is very heavy, as the down section of the piston is open, air is  allowed to release through the open outlet quickly without any control. Once the air presurre in the upward section of the pistons is leased the whole crane will bang down in one tenth of a second.

Improvements.

A. To reduce the difference of the speed ratio of the recoiling wheel and the extenable arms. I don't know wether you are willing to cut short for about 3 feet of the string. After cutting it, the hook can only reach the ground level not any further below. You have to measure it before you cut it, and make sure the length is right, as I do not know whether the length of this best quality string are of a standard length when came out of the factory. The reason is the diameter of the thread coil is too big when most of the string is returned to the coil, so the speed of releasing/ rewinding of the string would be much quicker than the extension or retract of the arms, sometimes making the movement out of control. After reduce the length of the string, it is still not 100% complying but the situation is much better and will have a better control.

B. To improve the pneumatics control, I added two air tanks to it. You may have to follow the suggested steps below, otherwise all the air stored in the tanks will released by just one downward movement. After the alteration, now,  I can have crane arm ( 2/3 extended), at least six up and seven down movements with two full tanks of compressed air.

Step 1. Plug the only open outlet on the air switch, ie fully air tight, no air can go through. To avoid the air leaking from the tanks when switching to lower the crame arms.

Step 2. Connect the air tanks and fixed at the left and right side of the crane, ie. move together with the crane platform is being turned. Comnect the hose to the pump and tanks. If you have the patience to read up to here, you should know how to connect air tanks.

Step 3. Connect the TWO open ends of the pistons ( ie one on each piston) by ONE single hose. pierce the hose (perferrably about one cm from one end, so that it can be reused in future by renmove this end)  with a thin pin, just pierce once, you don't have to see the hole, actually cannot be seen by naked eye. This is to controll the air relaesed from the pistons and hence the downward movement of the crane arm.

After the alteration, I still have to controll the switch very carefully and slowly, but its all under control. The above works quite well for my model. I don't think this alteration will damage the compressor or the pistons. Think about the recommendation to impove the machanics of your model, of course I cannot granantee anything here.

Any query write to me, may be I can send you the photographs of the alternations.

This is another  super-superstar of Technic, Great work by LEGO.

Brickmad

author: bambalero
title: Awesome Crane!
review:
Hi everyone,

I bought this set about 3 years ago, and just recently built it again.

If you are looking for building challenge and fun, this is a set to go. As other were saying, this will take hours (blissful hours) from your time....

I like the yellow color and all the functions - on the chassis (which you assembly first for both A & B models) you can see that it has steering on 6 out of the 8 wheels - the back ones turning the opposite to the 4 front ones - the turning ratio is great, allowing you to turn the whole crane on very little space. Another function is the lowering of the stabilizers, when they are all the way down the crane won't move. Sadly the steering wheel on the cockpit won't turn the wheels but you can't have it all right?

About the crane itself - A model:

The crane goes as the boxs depicts, a long way up! - this is my first and only pneumatic set, so I am not very familiar on how pumping works. I noticed that after a while, the pumps lose the air and pressure and the crane slowly falls - I am talking that this time would be hours, I noticed it on the morning. I solved this by adding an axle that would work as the one on the hood of real cars.

The crane has two battery powered functions - one to extend the telescopic boom / string and the other to raise / lower the string. It is a pity that when extending the boom the string also moves. I would have liked to have three movements - 1) only string 2) only telescopic and 3) both.

About other features - you have a V6 mounted which looks easily when you raise the crane, although maybe a V8 or 10 would have been more believable. It comes with a sheet of stickers, I did not apply them and I think the model does not need them to look great on display.

Overall, this is a great set. Do not expect it to get it cheap, but every cent is worth it. I have not built the B model - which is a lame (personally) option for the crane. Be sure to get your hands on it if you are a die hard fan as I am sure you are!

A word of advice - dust your legos often, and try to place them in a way to keep sunlight from them - bleaching from the sun affects these ABS bricks like you would not imagine.

author: the_squid
title: A beast to build
review:
When I first saw this model, I really wanted it...
Mechanical wise is it a very good copy of the real machine.

It's a big rig to build, so don't think you can build it in an hour or 2.
The build is nicely split up in different numbered bags.
Which saves you alot of time / work sorting all pieces out before you begin.

Pro's:
- It's BIG
- It's very 'real' compared to the real crane
- If you can get this one: buy it
- The steering is very nice

Con's:
- 1 or 2 steps in the instructions weren't too clear what you should do
- The pneumatics are a little light to keep the extended boom up 
(you need to really pressurize it)

author: propercornish
title: lego technic 8421 mobile crane
review:
This has got to be the best every set from lego technic. it took me a good 10 hours to build, i enjoy every minute of it. a great set which has sadly been discontinued! looking around the internet you can pick up a good second handed one for around £150 to £300. i have also seen the set is selling for £450 plus (brand new), which i think is alot for the  money for any set, but it is a master piece.

If you dont own one, you just dont appreciate how good the set looks.

author: TheAB
title: Great Set // Good Playability, Functions and Design
review:
All Terrain Crane best set ever by far. 8053 doesn't reach this one in terms of functions even though it gets close.

Box/Instructions

Huge rectangular box not yet eco-friendly. Wrnkled instructions not yet with cardboard sheet.

Parts

This set puts together Pneumatics with motorized functions with clutch. The good 62.4x20 wheels are present 8x here (www.bricklink.com/catalogItem.asp?P=32020c01). Not yet Power Functions elements but still Motor RC Race Buggy (www.bricklink.com/catalogItem.asp?P=5292). Also Pneumatics to raise the boom.

The build

Great building experience.

The completed model

Crane boom functions is the key strength of the set. 3 sections telescopic motorized boom is great. Also RC motor coupled with a clutch to handle 2 functions appreciable. Pneumatics to raise the boom, not working smoothly though when lowering it, this being the only weakness of the set. 4 stabilizers and dummy motor as well. Finally, the 3 axles steering system.

Design is very good and realistic. In this point 8053 is slightly better and more modern due to the use of curved Technic panels.

Summary

All in all a great set, with very high levels of functions, playability and design. The best Technic Crane set ever, even though 8288 (www.bricklink.com/catalogItem.asp?S=8288-1) is another must being a different kind of crane (Crawler Crane) with different functionalities.

author: Surya
title: Massive set
review:
I got this set recently, just a month after getting back into Lego Technic after 16 years. I had to get it because it looks great, and it has the most pieces of any Technic set.

Pros
- Looks great
- Very solid construction
- Lots of hours of building fun
- Dual telescoping broom
- The outriggers lock

Cons
- The wheels sometimes touch each other when turning
- The pneumatics don't offer a lot of control
- No winch for turning the crane on the carrier
- The string that's included is a bit too stiff and the hook isn't heavy enough. This is a problem because the hook doesn't lower evenly or even at all when trying to lower it.
- The building instructions weren't always entirely clear. They also didn't indicate where it was important to have axles at a certain angle. Annoying.

All in all a great set!

I was wondering if there is a proper B-Model for this one? I don't have the original instructions, and I can't seem to find any B-Model instructions on the net. I suppose the alternate crane is considered the B-Model...

author: Grogs
title: Solid and realistic
review:
With such a simplistic task, this model certainly lives up to the challenge

Box/Instructions

it came well packaged, nothing special here

Parts

a lot of technic parts (what do you expect??)  there is a friction gear, die-cast hook, battery box, 1 electric motor, 8 tires, and those funky 4 toothed gears (that i remember from the pit droid set, they allow gears to be at angles between 0 and 90 degrees, inclusive)

The build

took me a solid day to complete.  its great to see a model like this being built so you can see how the 3 axle steering works (which, for being lego, was solidly made and calibrated) 

The completed model

the support in the front sometimes gets "bent" out of the way

Summary

Pick this up for the future mechanical engineer!

author: Bighitrider
title: must have!
review:
I bought this set 2 weeksago  for very good price with box, books, extra parts. After i build it i was a lil bit disappointed cos i tought the crane is higher, but now i satisfied with it. The building is easy by following the instructions, it took me 10-12 hour to finish it, nothing special, but very enjoyable and good. I think this set is one of the best set ever, its very complex with tons of parts, and the size of the mobile crane is very impressive. To tell the trut i cant say any bad about this set cos its ***** good. Only negative thing is the high price , fortunately  i bought it very cheap.

Pros: 6 wheel steering
differential
v6
size and tons of parts

Cons:VERY high price! but its a must have :D

author: Victor_c3
title: Lots of pieces, but overall nothing special
review:
I bought this set and first put it together in November 2007. I just got out of the Army, I was unemployed, and I was feeling a little "nerdy" so I went out and indulged myself. Everyone was saying that this "was the set to own" and, having not played with legos since I was a kid and most modern set in my collection at the time was the 8868 (air tech claw rig), I figured that a large set like this would be a great way to modernize my collection. I almost never played with the models themselves, but instead I used the pieces to make my own MOCs.

 

Since I was "out of the loop" in building techniques and the stud-less building process, I opted to build this model at least once. I spend hours and hours working on putting this thing together and was sort of disappointed when I was done. Functionally, the mechanisms were nothing special. The turntable which the crane was mounted to didn't move through any sort of a drive mechanism (you have to push it around with your hand) and I feel the functionally, the model could have had more. The only part that I really found intriguing and exciting about the model was the telescoping crane arm (which is definitely worth looking at).

 

The best part of this model is the large number of pieces in it. For that reason alone, I'm glad that I picked up the model. However, seeing that this model is going for a crazy inflated price on the internet(s), you'd be better off picking up the bits and pieces that you wanted off of brick link.

 

I recently rebuilt this model with the (nominal) help of my four year old daughter. She likes playing with the crane and driving the truck. Like was mentioned in other reviews already, I found the string to be too stiff or the hook to not be heavy enough. So I have to help her lift and lower things to keep the string from getting tangled. I appreciate the clutch pieces that they installed in the crane arm, however I don't think they are very useful in this model. The white clutch gear that drives the telescoping motion of the crane arm slips too much and it take a long time for the arm to extend or retract. I remedied that by swapping the clutch gear for a non-clutch gear of the same size. Now I just have to be mindful of the crane arm when it gets close to the min or max of its movements. The other clutch gear (the one attached to the string spindle) is almost a cruel joke. With the issue of the string/hook, you need to life stuff that has enough weight on it to keep the string from getting tangled. However, if you try to lift stuff that is too heavy it slips. It works well enough that I haven't felt compelled to swap it out for a non-clutching gear.

 

Overall, this model isn't anything special. It's big and has a lot of pieces - and that is the best thing going for it.

author: netmike83
title: 8421 - Review
review: Best crane set ever ...
